name: Jerk Chicken and Pineapple Skewers
headline: Chicken and Pineapple Skewers with Jerk Marinade
recipeIngredient: 1 Scotch bonnet or habanero chile, stemmed and seeded
2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast, chopped into 1 1/4-inch cubes
1 large red onion, diced into 1 1/4-inch pieces
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
3 cups fresh pineapple cut into 1 1/4-inch chunks
1 to 2 large green peppers, diced into 1 1/4-inch pieces
Nonstick cooking spray, for the grill grates

recipeInstructions.text: For the jerk marinade: Combine the brown sugar, lime juice, orange juice, oil, soy sauce, vinegar, allspice, ginger, salt, thyme, cinnamon, nutmeg, garlic, bay leaf, chile and scallion in a food processor and puree. (You can mix in a bowl if you don't have a food processor.)
For the kebabs: Place the chicken in a gallon-size resealable bag. Pour the marinade over the chicken (reserve any extra marinade for later use). Seal the bag and refrigerate 1 hour.
Sprinkle the red onion with salt and pepper. Assemble metal skewers with the chicken, red onion, pineapple and peppers, alternating each ingredient. Brush the kebabs with the remaining marinade.
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Spray the grill grates with cooking spray.
Grill the kebabs until the chicken registers 165 degrees F in the center on an instant-read thermometer, about 4 minutes per side. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: These were really good. Next time I will add more green onions and fresh ginger rather than ground. I did add more garlic because I always do. Served with coconut rice and roasted broccoli. Perfect!

Miss Brown, this is the most delicious recipe. I have made it several times, I grew my own habanero chilis to use. Thank you for sharing all your recipes. I have not found any of them less that exquisite.
Dang! This smells and tastes amazing. Even my picky eaters in the family ate this up when I used it with chicken breast, definitely a keeper
Great recipe, had to marinate chicken over 24 hours (snowed here) and the flavor was still awesome!
Soooo good! Used 1 habanero and was great! Spicy for sure but perfect with sweet spices. Put over brown rice..Going on my faves board!
OMG!  This was so delicious!   I followed the recipe as written and loved it!  This is definitely going in rotation at the Fisher house.  ❤️

It was delicious! I wanted more chicken and pineapple than veggies (don’t tell my mom!) but the chicken soaked up that marinade so well. Each bite was packed with flavor! I’ll definitely make this again and again.

These skewers were very easy to make and the marinate was delicious!  I didn’t have all of the individual spices listed, so I used pumpkin pie spice for the warm spices and it worked fine.  I also added a little cayenne to give more of a kick.  I will definitely make this again.
Very easy and delicious! A definite repeat recipe!

DELICIOUS! We are growing scotch bonnets this season, and we love heat, so we used 2. This recipe is divine! The spices, the acid, the heat- it was amazing. My hubs, picky in-laws, and I all loved it!! Definitely going to be making this again and again. Thank you!

wonderful jerk marinade and sauce! Added yellow squash to kabobs in addition to red bell peppers, onions & pineapple. served with grilled corn & wild rice. Boiled leftover jerk marinade and poured over rice. Loved by all!!

This recipe is it! Nailed this one! It is delicious and the flavors are all there when served. I will definitely be recommending it. No substitutions, followed to a T, except I added mushrooms to the skewers. I’ll be making this one over and over! Thank you for sharing! ❤️

This marinade is amazing!
I have used a few jerk recipes in the past because my family loves the flavors when done properly. This is definitely a keeper. Thanks for another delicious recipe Kardea!

video.name: Grilled Jerk Chicken Skewers
video.description: Chef Kardea Brown creates a hot and citrusy marinade of Caribbean flavors for these gorgeously charred kebabs.
